content.description:
This is a fun, little consolation prize if the

Slim Jim

shuts the group down.

Work you way up on to the ledge/bulge, and then work you way up the blank bulge to the top via Braille.
content.location:
It is just around to the right of the

Slim Jim

.

content.description: This problem involves very intricate technical slab work, get the sequence right or flounder. I suggest if you want to climb this try when it's cold and your fresh and feeling strong perhaps.  I have done it a handful of times one day 3 times in a row.  I have been shut down far more often however, I was shut down the last 3 times I have gone to the slab. What is this thing really rated?
content.location: This is on the north-facing side that is a super smooth slab with virtually only 1 decent hold minus the 3-4 micro features.

content.description:
On the overhanging side facing the trail you S.D.S. on the left most arete and squeeze and slap upward  while trending sightly left to a killer finish.  A great blank, but very possible alternative to the

Super Slab

and the other low angle problems on this boulder.  It's worth the slap.
content.location: Located on the same block as the Super Slab.  The line faces the trail and starts at the far left bottom of that side of the wall.
